intro: Centaurea brevicaulis, commonly known as the short-stemmed cornflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and bright blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters and features slender, hairy stems. Its leaves are linear to lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are arranged in dense, spike-like clusters. Centaurea brevicaulis is often found in grasslands, wastelands, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
